Reviews.Title: “All change!”
Reviews.Author: HollyLovesLondon
Reviews.Content: Wow! When my boyfriend text me the address of what he had booked I thought 'crap, small hotels don't clean properly' and I thought I was going to have been eaten alive by bedbugs. I didn't even dare to check trip advisor. When I got in, the reception was clean and the staff was friendly and professional. The hallways were clean and well maintained. Our room was gorgeous, a great colour, clean and bright with a brand new super clean en suite! I looked at the old photos of this hotel and it looks like a different place all together. I stayed in my comfy bed until checkout (well I'm writing this from my hotel room). Everything is nice and simple and I think they have done a great job well done Rose court!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Dave9
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for one night on business as a 'late room' for only 54GBP. I had a basement room and thought 'oh no' but it was actually very nice and did have a window. The rooms are small but not tiny and there was room to move around. Best of all the rooms are all 100% brand new - everything from the shower to the bed and carpets have been replaced very recently. There were toiletries and tea/coffee making facilities - again new. The standard was good - if you think premier inn standard you would be about right. Breakfast was continental and simple - cereals, orange juice, toast, coissant, cheese and ham, coffee. I was quite full though. On the down side, the heating is rather sparce. There was a plug in radiator in my room but the breakfast room was freezing. Also - the hotel layout is two converted town houses, both sides identical. On my return to the hotel in the evening, I asked for my key and went to the wrong side. Seeing a different room number on the door, I thought I'd asked for the wrong key and went back to reception to swap it- to be handed a second key without question. This was in fact not my room and someone else's luggage was inside. Realising I had gone to the wrong part of the hotel, I was rather embarassed but soon got my own key back. The issue was that the reception simply handed over someone else's room key to me without question and didn't check my check-in details. I'd definately book again though and would recommend a stay for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in good place”
Reviews.Author: AnneJenny405
Reviews.Content: First, in London there are two hotels which have same name and hotels are quite near each other. So pay attention with the address when you take a taxi to the hotel. Our room was quite big and decoration was poor. But in the room there were everything we needeed.Bathroom was small and the we had some troubles to fit in the showercabin, the door didn't open so much. If you are looking for luxus, don't stay here. But we found the hotel good for us. Breakfast was basic:coffee/tea, toast, cheese, eggs, beans (!). The hotel situated in a great place; only few hundred meters from railwaystation.That was the best part of hotel. If you want to stay in London and look around the city, we can recommend this.But don't excpect too much. It doesn't cost much and it's near the Regent's park and neat the Paddington station.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay if weather is cold”
Reviews.Author: David R
Reviews.Content: I was shocked to find a London Hotel without heating! Basic accomodation without flair, at a moderate price. Breakfast service less than basic. Hotel of last resort,but good location. Needs to reassess it's potential,

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Julie W
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel only because of it's great location, so close to Oxford street, being perfect if you come to London for some shopping. lot of other possibilities for different hotel but i always liked the small cozy hotel and the staff is very friendly. i really had a great time, thanks

Reviews.Title: “A nice refurbished hotel and super location”
Reviews.Author: david b
Reviews.Content: Some reviews nearly put us off, but on arrival pleasantly surprised by a recent refurbishment. Staff were very helpful and informative. A pleasant visit in all so thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Good refurbished hotel”
Reviews.Author: RichB660
Reviews.Content: I was almost put off with the previous negative reviews but having decided to make my own mind up i was pleasantly surprised after my recent 2 day stay. The hotel has been refurbished, management changed and staff very friendly and informative, worthy of a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Gina H
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that this hotel is in need of refurbishment, the prices reflect this and the new management apear to be professional and passionate hoteliers who are keen to make the necessary improvements. The reception staff were friendly and efficient and what the facilities lacked the staff more than made up for in their attitude. Great location and we will look forward to returning on our next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs changes”
Reviews.Author: George N
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice to an extremely good location, with nice decoration and good facilities! The heating was nice and the room was huge! The bad things with this hotel are the extremely tiny lift and that the walls need painting (there are yellow marks on the roof etc). It can be much better with some changes but I liked it anyway! I can recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A TOTAL NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Lisa M
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do,.,,, do not stay here. What a disaster. Dirty dirty nasty. Wallpaper hanging off the walls! Curtain torn and half way hanging down. Filthy dirty Rotten and uh so ugly. You will regret ever stepping foot over the threshhold. We had to go to another hotel with two children in the middle of the night!

Reviews.Title: “Needs the hotel inspector!”
Reviews.Author: Scoobydoo859
Reviews.Content: Booked into the hotel by our company when our usual hotel was full and the location was important to us. From outside it looks good, reception okay but when you walk through the doors its a different story. If you have children don't use the lift! Got to the room, bed was clean but thats it. Where repairs have been carried out on the walls the filler is just left unpainted,radiator had very little paint left on it. I would say the stairs have not been painted for decades,really dirty. Everything is chipped and has a layer of dust. Grouting in the bathroom missing everywhere. Nowhere to even hang a towel when your in the bath. Curtains hanging off the rails and generally shabby. Heat in the room was dreadful but no one could turn it down as the valve was missing. Miss the toast for breakfast - you've heard of extra thick bread, well this was extra thin - never seen anything like it.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: Very poor standards in this hotel. The toilet wasn't grouted into the floor properly so was wobbly and leaked all over the bathroom floor, the mains electric would trip regularly which I was told by reception happened all the time and that they are lucky if they get half an hour before the lights go off again so that was fun having no lights in the apart from dodgy little lamps supplied and having to trip the mains switch in the hall to get lights back and avoid going to the bathroom in the dark, or risk being electrocuted by taking the lamp in the leaking bathroom. To make matters worse the shower hook was broken and the shower head old and clogged so having a shower wasn't very easy. Hoping that the breakfast would go some way to salvaging something from our stay we disappointed again to be presented with a microwaved cheap croissant, and low quality cheese slices and ham as the only real breakfast option. I don't expect much for Â£120 per night in London but I think it is fair to expect lights, a working toilet and shower and reasonable food, none of which this hotel seem able to provide or in the least bit worried about when I challenged them on my departure. They attempted to tell me that the hotel had been worse in the past and they had improved as if this had some relevance to my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wan ahmad k
Reviews.Content: Good location, good front desk staff. Even offered us complimentary breakfast upon check in. Nevertheless, the bathroom was very small and so is the elevator which remind me of the stories from Alfred Hitchcock. Wifi is only limited to the common areas and the restaurant. No left luggage areas where we just have to store the luggages in the reception area where security is not there at all. Could have been better.

Reviews.Title: “waiste of money”
Reviews.Author: munawar j
Reviews.Content: I had a lot of appreciation for agoda but after this booking I felt so sorry that for earning money agoda can go that low even i call it ripping off my pocket by booking such a ugly hotel where the price was so high and the hotel standard was so poor quality and un becoming of a decent hotel. I feel agoda is responsible for all this miss happenings and pocket ripping for their customers. itâ€™s better to ask for money as donation if agoda wants money rather than robbing some bodyâ€™s pocket like agoda did with me for booing this hotel, shame on agoda and shame on the way they earn money. agoda has charge me Total / Room Charge: USD 565.92 for two nights which is far more then what the hotel offers their customers on desk, only 75 GBP for a night, I must say shame on agoda once again. i have booked for a single room but I donâ€™t understand why agoda booked quad room type for me? I highly protest against agoda for robbing on my pocket for this booking and claim my money back.

Reviews.Title: “Remember it's being refurbished!”
Reviews.Author: DaniDPeterborough
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews of this hotel, I was dubious of booking but we were looking for a cheap nights stay in London so decided to go for it. My Mum, 2 sisters and I were greeted with a smile and a nice bright reception area. We stayed in room 109 on the 1st floor, a quadruple room with 2 singles and 1 double. It was bright with 3 windows (1 of which didn't open but wasn't a problem). I had requested room with a window when i booked. Yes, the room was tired and In need of updating but we decided to close our eyes to it as we were only needing somewhere to sleep for 1 night. The beds were clean and comfy so what more do you need?! We all slept well and all had a shower with hot water in the morning. The view wasn't good from the windows, but who sits and looks out of the window when you're there for 1 night, be realistic! The location of our room meant we could pick up wifi from the ASK restaurant below so didn't need to bother to ask for the hotels's wifi password. The staff were friendly and helpful, they bought us extra pillows on request. The breakfast room is undergoing re-wiring works so is not in the best of states but didn't affect us. The breakfast was a basic, but very nice continental with a small choice of cereal, hot toast, coissant and cheese and ham. Tea and coffee, orange juice and water were available. The waitress bought us more toast on request. Again, friendly staff. We were full and didn't need to eat again until late afternoon! At check out, we were able to leave our bags at the hotel so we could enjoy the day and collected them later. The hotel is in a brilliant location in Paddington, 3 minute walk from the station and there is a huge selection of restaurants, cafe's and pubs/bars to choose from if you're not heading further into the city. Overall, our stay was very good considering we paid only Â£42 each for the night! My advice would be that if you're not laid back and fussy, don't book here, pay triple the price to stay somewhere else! If you're looking for a cheap place to rest your head and can overlook the bad bits, go for it! Remember that the hotel is being refurbished so it's not like they're not doing anything to change it, they just don't have the money to shut down completely while the work is done like The Savoy did! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A bit run down”
Reviews.Author: Sandy K
Reviews.Content: Location was great for access to main shopping street and Hyde Park and the staff were very friendly, but sadly the rooms were very tired, small and seemed to lean down one side. The cupboard was also on a lean due to the floor sloping down. Cupboard under the TV had broken door on the front. The lift was very tiny, only one person at a time with a suitcase or two people with no luggage. Breakfast was very basic, no reception for internet in your room, you had to go downstairs in the main lounge area to use it. We were a family of two elderly parents, myself and my brother and our rooms were quite a fair distance apart

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the 5th floor Annex!”
Reviews.Author: luvhb
Reviews.Content: The Rose Court hotel is conveniently located near Paddington Station which offers direct access to London Heathrow (via Heathrow Express, Connect, and the tube) and many other locations throughout the UK via trian. There are many Victorian-era guest houses and B&Bs in the Paddington Station neighborhood; I chose the Rose Court Hotel because it advertised a lift and my mother has mobility problems. When my mom and I arrived, we were assigned a room on the 5th floor- the elevator only went to the 4th floor. To get to our room, we had to take the elevator up to the 4th floor, up a flight of stairs, then go down the hallway into what appeared to be another building to get to our room. The room had dirty walls and a little mold in the bathroom. When I made my reservation, I had communicated our mobility limitations and had requested a room on a low floor. I was very disappointed to find we were given one of the most inconvenient rooms in the hotel. I travel enough not to expect luxury for this price in London, but I was very disappointed with this experience. I liked the location and plan to stay near Paddington station on my next visit to London, but will not choose the Rose Court hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ripped off, never again!”
Reviews.Author: ditterz
Reviews.Content: Bad points were: Booking.com advertised it as 3 star, but it was more like 1 star, the jackhammer in the morning, the stained walls and ceiling, the lack of fruit in the buffet breakfast. The lack of free wifi which was advertised, but not working due to renovations in progress. I had to pay 20 pound for a USB Key to access the internet but the management would only give me a 15 pound discount. The hot water takes 10 minutes to run hot. My first shower was luke warm. There was a round hole cut in the glass of our bathroom, so we couldn't shut out the construction noise. There is no lift, we had to lug our bags up the stairs (1st floor luckily). The rooms were very tiny, old and grotty. Way overpriced. We were charged Â£ 337.00 for 3 nights in a really noisy, grubby, old room. Plus cracked coffee cups in the room. Good points were: location near Paddington station and near Hyde Park, freshly cooked poached eggs for breakfast, Ok coffee, fresh toast, kettle in room.

Reviews.Title: “We found it very handy to get to all the attractions”
Reviews.Author: BLONDEEN
Reviews.Content: We originally wanted to be in a hotel near to Hyde Park but we found this hotel very handy for all attractions,it was in a lovely area and compared to other people we spoke to on our long weekend in London it was very good value for money,we will certainly return again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Yngvem
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels we've ever stayed at. The door wouldn't open moore than 1/3. Why? Because the room was so small that the only way to fit the bed in, meant blocking the door. We had paid for a room with a toilet, but were given a room without one, and were not allowed to change rooms - or given a discount. We had a shower though, but it looked like it was mostly used as a toilet. The room looked and smelled as if it hadn't been cleaned since the 1980s. If we hadn't arrived at midnight we would have walked out of the place. We didn't dare to stay for breakfast, and we weren't the only ones. Do NOT stay at Rose Court Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: daytrippers186338
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on 25th June 2011 to attend a concert in Hyde Park. 2 rooms, unfortunately on seperate floors, but were given the option to change - didn't like the alternative. Was not looking forward to the visit after reading reviews on this site, but was pleasantly surprised. Yes, it definitely needs redecorating and the breakfast wasn't the best we'd ever had. The location, however, is excellent and the staff were very helpful and friendly. For the price we paid, it was excellent value and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “i hated it and will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: penfold0180
Reviews.Content: i stayed their on the 09/07/2011. the hotel was very grotty. i stayed in a single room on the 5th floor. the room was so small i had to walk into the room sideways. the shower had black mould all around it. A cockroach dropped down on me in the shower. the bedroom was disgusting walls were dirty, dead flys on window sill. the bed had no headboard. the tv did not work. I was booked to have a breakfast but due to the standards left hotel in the early morning

Reviews.Title: “Dark, very very small room - stuffy, almost hard to breathe!”
Reviews.Author: From-an-Israeli-Scot
Reviews.Content: The hotels location is superb, but that's where the compliments end. It was a tiny room, and had no air in it. My girlfriend and I woke up many times in night, very dehydrated. Really pretty unpleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kal_papas
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family and together with another family (total 8 persons) on the ground in 2 quadruple rooms from July 1 to July 5, 2011. Actually reading a few months now reviews for this hotel, expecting to find a shabby hotel with rude staff. But none of this did not happen! The hotel is a decent little old building in a beautiful location. The staff was very polite (especially the man at the reception in the evening) Our own rooms were big and bright. The sleep was great. The breakfast was what is usually served in such hotels. The guests were all neat and every morning when I meet them at breakfast, they were smiling and in no case gave me the impression that they did not pass well. I think (unless we stayed at the best hotel rooms) that the hotel is not as described by other tenants. I definitely would stay again in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “stay away”
Reviews.Author: amhair
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unsafe dirty and shabby and staff are rude.

Reviews.Title: “Dark rooms, hammering at 7:30 am, shower covered with mold”
Reviews.Author: neitsytmaria
Reviews.Content: We paid 55 pound per night for a twin room. The location was nice, one block away from Paddington station. The room was poor. It was really dark, no light coming from the window as we were in the first floor. The lamp was so weak we couldnâ€™t see a thing. The room smelled like mold. The source of the smell could be found in the bathroom: the shower stall was covered with green mold. The beds were ok, but at 7:30 we woke up to the sound of hammering. The next morning they started at 8:00, this time with a drill. We got another room, but it was right opposite the stairs you had to take on your way to the breakfast room. The wall was very thin, so we woke up at 7:30 to the sound of the people walking and talking in the corridor. The staff was mostly nice, but not always competent. There was no safety deposit box in the room and the lock looked like it wouldnâ€™t keep anyone out. I left my laptop to the hotelâ€™s â€œsafety deposit boxâ€�, which turned out to be the counter. When I tried to pick it up later, the person behind the desk had absolutely no idea where my laptop could be. After searching it for some time he found it. In the first morning the breakfast was decent: beans, eggs, toast, cereal, milk, orange juice, tea. The next morning the only thing that was left were the cereal and milk. We asked to get some tea and eggs, which they promised to deliver. Then they started to clean the tables. I, again, asked for some tea and eggs. Again, they promised to bring them. The third time I went straight to the kitchen and got my eggs and tea.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! I beg you not to book it, go ANYWHERE else”
Reviews.Author: Defn
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here. This hotel is a complete dump! We paid Â£128 to stay here two nights in June 2011. Don't be fooled by the charming exterior or reception, beyond this point, you enter the realms of hell!!!!! Ended up booking somewhere else instead as we couldn't bear to spend two nights here. We got no sleep, our beds were itchy and horrible. The sockets were hanging off the wall and there were nasty stains all over the walls. Bathroom was worst ever. Thick mould everywhere!!!! I am going to contact the local council about this hotel because it should be shut down!!!!

Reviews.Title: “No..It's pretty bad”
Reviews.Author: UkSwiss
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but that is the end of my positive comments. I would stay here again as a last resort only, and I must say that I dont like to watch constant bickering, and staff arguments...I observed this three times over a one night stay. All the staff are foreign, as were all the guests. The guests will be booking on price alone, and I must say that Â£135 for this place is robbery.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Dump Ever, budget hotel or not.”
Reviews.Author: STL8888
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that we decided to stay at this hotel because it was next to Paddington Station in central london so we were looking for a budget hotel and had low expectations to begin with. What we got was totally unacceptable by anyones standards. When we checked in we were offered 10 pounds off the price we agreed to pay through priceline because the guy knew what a dump he was putting us in. After we checked in the room it was clear 10 pounds off wasn't nearly enough. You'd have to pay me to stay there again. Not kidding I would've rather slept on the floor of Heathrow airport than stay here. It was so bad I took pictures. Please look before staying here! No A/C also.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Nero11
Reviews.Content: Given its location in a well-to-do street a few yards from Marble Arch, the hotel is very fairly priced but don't expect luxury. Certainly shabby and in need of major refurbishing inside, but friendly, helpful, respectable and - not wishing to condemn with faint praise - extremely adequate for a budget conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Angie186525
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend trip to this hotel, our room was in the basement, the heating on permanently, could'nt sleep because of the heat, breakfast was abysmal, continental, cereal and toast, thats it, no meats, cheese etc. I have returned home and found bites on my legs, I presume from the mattress, I would never recommend this hotel, very run down,

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, concidering the price”
Reviews.Author: mackan74
Reviews.Content: Im currently staying in the hotel and this is my (re)view on the stay. To put it short, the hotel offers good vale for the money, but i wouldn't stay here for an extended stay, since the standard is a bit low. Howver for a weekend trip it's great value. Pros: -The staff is nice, helpful and polite -Great value for the money -Good cleaning / clean and ok rooms in general Neutral: -Breakfast dosen't offer anything special. The try to make it british by serving white beans is a really sweet try at best, by the rest of the traditional food is missing. So, not the best I have seen and certanly not the worst. -TV is a 5 channel one. In bigger hotels you can get more channels, but of course most of us dosen't go on a trip to watch tv. Cons: -Sometimes disturbing traffic sound in the morning -Elevator out of order -Some funny smell from some of the the corridors(a maze to walk through), leading to the room -Ventilation could be better.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: Golle
Reviews.Content: but of course itÂ´s a matter of opinion. The hotel, as many of them do, sounds quaint and delightful, but itÂ´s not. The staff were unbeliaveble rude, except one man who seemed to be doing everything himself. Lift worked, room was good, bathroom functioned without problem. In fact I was a bit surprised to see the mirror had heat in it, so the moment I stepped out from my shower, the mirror was clear. You are right next to the street and it makes some noise. First night I had trouble sleeping, but nothing too bad. The room could be cleaned more often, I agree, but we had our sheets changed twice on four days. Nothing was broken, nothing didnÂ´t work, so good value for money. And the location is great!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: hejerika
Reviews.Content: I read all the reviews before i went to London and stayed at Rose Court Hotel. My expectations were very low and I expected the worst. Maybe that's why I enjoyed the stay at the Rose Court Hotel. The service was amazing! The only problem we noticed was the shower, sometimes the water was too hot or too cold. The standad was low but what else can you expect for a cheap hotel with the most perfect location? Everything was close and instead of taking the tube or the bus you could walk anywhere. I don't think you can get a hotel with that location somewhere else within walking distance to mostly everything. Always remember; you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: prajpix
Reviews.Content: Outside it looks great and that is where it ends. Carpet manky, walls grubby, room dismal, dimly lit and pokey. As for the brown stained toilet seat and disgusting mouldy shower......... Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “oh my goodness”
Reviews.Author: raez52
Reviews.Content: i stayed two nights in rose court hotel i should have quessed what the rooms would be like when i saw the tape sealing a tear in the leather sofa, the receptionists were not friendly or helpful, i had a room down in the basement, i couldnt believe the dirty walls, the bed didnt smell too nice either, and there were damp marks on the ceiling in the bathroom, i felt very uncomfortable being there in the basement as a women by herself, the room was extremely small, and the window didnt open for fresh air and to get the musty smell out of the room, i sat on the bed the first night and cried i had saved for ages for my trip, i stayed two nights and on the third night went to another hotel which was 100% cleaner and the staff more helpful and friendlier, never again

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt go back”
Reviews.Author: Erica89
Reviews.Content: great location just off oxford st but hotel is very basic, staff on reception not particularly nice. We stayed in a dungeon in the basement absolutley freezing cold, heater didnt do much. Shower has a mind of its own roasting one min freezing the next. Wouldnt return but if your just looking 4 someone to lay your head it will do the job.

Reviews.Title: “Dump,room G05,worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rutter123
Reviews.Content: Bars at window,cracked toilet seat repaird with glue,rust around shower screen,rusty taps, enamel chipped off shower base mildew on tiles & cealing ,dirty paintwork,tv plug eath pin missing ,the list goes on.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful - what do you expect for the price?”
Reviews.Author: welshlady1967
Reviews.Content: Location is great - only a couple of minues to walk from Paddington. Staff at reception were friendly and helpful when we needed to ask something. We were a group of 10 and although we did not have rooms on the same floor, it was o.k. Not fab if you are on the 5th floor as the lift only goes as far as the 4th, so you have to take the stairs for the last bit. Breakfast was fine - tea/juice/cereals/toast/fried egg and beans and plenty of it. Clean, crisp bed linen. Overall the hotel is a bit dated, but is good value for money if you don't want to spend much time there, just using it as a base to go sightseeing from.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even think about it...”
Reviews.Author: gino12
Reviews.Content: If you didn't book a room yet, I stronly suggest you navigate away from their webpage, the rooms are nothing what you see on the pictures. I booked mine well in advance but still when i arrived I was given a room on the last floor; the walls were cracked, you could smell a stench out of the beds, there was some kind of electric wires hanging from the roof and i won't bother talking about the bathroom...the appliances were merely a non-functional tv, a hairdryer hanging from a pin on the central wall, a half-broken cupboard and a relatively decent set of tea packs with cups. Don't ask about the staff, no one will help you, especially the hispanic redhead lady.(I had to carry my 2 big luggages all the way down alone because she was 'busy' on her pc). Anyways I did move out two days after my arrival because this was just unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: singlemale
Reviews.Content: I had a basement room looking onto a yard. I could just get through the door. There were three single beds pushed together with less than 18 inches each side of the room. The television had a poor signal. I could not switch out the light from the bed. Water came from everywhere in the shower except where it should have done. I did not sleep due to clog dancers or an obese team of high jumpers practicing in the room above. I paid Â£110 for two nights but only stayed the first night as I could not stand a second night, particularly after seeing the dead mouse on the dining room floor at breakfast!!! I am still waiting for a reply to my letter of complaint. The place should be closed down for refurbishment.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley disgusting”
Reviews.Author: ricky076
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for one night only on business. We picked the hotel due to location only. From the outside it seems nice and freshly painted, but as soon as you walk into the reception area the alarm bells started to ring in my head. Shabby, smelly and very very tired. We were given two rooms in the basement area, having to walk through a maze of smelly corridors to find the rooms was an eye opener. There had been no attempt to hide anything from brooms to cleaning buckets and old sorts of painting sheets, lying in door ways. The rooms were smelly with old stains on carpets, stains on old tables that just seem to be thrown into the rooms, nothing matches bathrooms although not too dirty were still old and tired. I sat on bed and cried it was that bad. My collegue went down to reception and complained immediately but was told there were no more vacant rooms, she offered complimentary breakfasts but no way would we even comtemplating eating in such a poor hotel. I have stayed in many hotels throughout Europe and beyond and I dont think to charge Â£102.00 a night each is reasonable, it may be in the heart of London but there really is no need to rip people off like this. I should have thought even the most experienced back packer would have walked away from this hotel! Dont waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and central”
Reviews.Author: LaurieAnnee
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious and had two double beds in it. Our room was quite hot but then it was winter. Very central and easy to get around London from here. Good value. Breakfast was basic but fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gettingoutofkansas
Reviews.Content: I too did not know what to expect from this hotel, but it was overall a good choice with a few caveats. The Good, Very friendly and accomodating staff, a small but decent breakfast. Our booking was for a twin room (two twin beds), When we stopped by early in the morning, we had no trouble leaving our bags until check-in. When we got back later in the evening and actually went to get our room, they didn't have any twins left, so we ended up getting a triple. (one double, one twin), upgrade. The Bad Older building with slightly creaky floor above us, with guests who liked to get up earlier than we did (like 0530). We went during record setting heat, and we did not have any control over the temperature in the room. We had a window, but it opened onto an alley and we got no air movement. So it was uncomfortably hot for us, but we like our hotel rooms a bit on the cooler side. Overall. Great access to Paddington Station in a quiet area. The hotel has only a few and relatively expensive shopping and eating venues around it. We saved a bunch of money and used it to enjoy the city, and did not have enough energy to enjoy opulent hotel amenities. If you are used to a higher class of hotel this may not be for you, but we are experienced travellers and this is a decent hotel for its class and price.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to going back”
Reviews.Author: craigmyr
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the horror story reviews of this hotel, I was curious if not anxious. Our experience was anything but horrible. Staff was great, rooms and hotel were clean, location was perfect. Although the bathroom was very small it was functional. Television worked for what small amount of time we spent in the room. The view from the room was pleasant. The breakfast was simple but enjoyable. The only downside was the very small lift, which was only an issue since we were on the fourth floor and only when we had luggage. We will definately stay at the Rose Court on our next visit to London.

Reviews.Title: “Central - but low quality”
Reviews.Author: Indochinaexplorer
Reviews.Content: * Ok beds * Nice reception service * Small dark rooms (I got a basment room to the back yard) * Poor TV signal * Very basic brakfast - toast/serials/eggs & baked beens - tea/coffe/juice. Poor made.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for limited budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: stormdesign
Reviews.Content: As most people know, London is a very expensive city, especially when it comes to hotels/accommodation. I chose this hotel as I was travelling with a budget concious group, and i wasn't really expecting much. Even though it's a "low cost" hotel, I found it to be comfortable enough. If ur looking for a nice and stylish looking hotel steer away, but if a clean, decent size room with a comfortable bed is enough for you, this could be the hotel you are looking for. The hotel is extremely central, and practically 1 minute walk away from marble arch and Oxford street. pretty good if you are on a shopping trip. Breakfast was mediocre and consisted basically of just cereals and toasted bread. if you want something else, or perhaps a full English breakfast you have to pay extra. We ended up skipping breakfast for the rest of our stay, and opted in for a pret/mc donalds/kfc breakfast which is usually quite cheap. One small thing that I disliked was that on the final day we needed to store the luggage before going out for the last few hrs in London... unfortunately they don't have a storage room and the uncaring reception lady didn't' look very convincing. - Everything was still there on arrival so i cant really complain. An added bonus was the free WIFI available in the lobby. very handy (since we had to check online for flight cancellations due to ash cloud!)

Reviews.Title: “Just plain scary...”
Reviews.Author: humanbeingLondon
Reviews.Content: Left the booking of hotel to colleague... never again. Here are some key points: Dirty Carpet Paint falling off walls Damp patches Television was missing in room, the re-appeared Shower dirty Broken tiles in shower / sharp could easily cut. Terrible grouting Warped shower door would not close properly Bed Spread very very suspect Sink broken Plug for sink supplied / lose on a chain Previous fitting for sink drainage lever covered with tape Paid Â£84 for a "double room" yet colleague paid Â£75 for a single, yet beds were exactly the same size? both rooms of very similar standard. Just not a great place to stay......

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs at the Rose Court Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jasmir
Reviews.Content: The Rose Court Hotel is near Paddington Station and in a small courtyard, Talbot Square with a quaint garden in front. This area is filled with hotels, some probably just as bad as the Rose Court, some better. Face facts and realize that you will probably have to pay at least double what you pay at Rose Court to get a decent room in the area-do you want your vacation ruined? No, then pay more. At one time The Rose Court was probably a quaint and elegant London Hotel, but that shipped sailed about 75 years ago. They have a lounge area that has wireless internet and a computer (you must pay to use that) and chairs and a large screen TV, that is not too bad. They serve breakfast in the basement, they bring toast to your table and they have baked beans (a strange British breakfast food), green eggs (Dr. Suess anyone?) that weren't meant to be green I am sure, tea, coffee and juice, not great, not horrible--I wouldn't write home about it. We got a family room on the 1st floor (above the ground floor). It was a large room and had a double bed and two twins. We had a view of a dirty court yard filled with trash (fine I can live with that). The bathroom was big, had mold (I can live with that too). The toilet seat was literally not attached and would fall off if you sat on it (squatting anyone? Fine, I can live with that too, for the price). What I cannot live with is BEDBUGS. I went to sleep with all the lights on, I checked the beds and saw no bugs. I woke up about 3 am with my chest and arm itching horribly. UH OH! Checked out the bed and saw a bug crawling on my pillow. Took a video and saw another bug crawling up the wall. Took off my sweater and saw a bug on me! YUCK! Took the pillow with said bug to front desk to prove that they have bed bugs. The front desk person acted very surprised and said, we don't have bugs, I don't know what happened! Guess what Rose Court? You do have bugs and you need to close for at least one week and fumigate and kill all of the bed bugs-that is unsanitary, disgusting and you will end up losing money and maybe be closed down, so deal with it. The Rose Court has the potential of being an elegant establishment once again. But, at the VERY LEAST, close and rid yourself of the bugs! We did get our money back (although we had to pay for the night we stayed-great, I paid to be bitten by bugs!). We moved to another hotel, and paid double, a couple of blocks away, the Shaftesbury. It had cable in the room (Rose Court does not), fluffy down comforters (bug free!) as opposed to Rose Courts nasty unwashed bedspreads and "tartan" blankets infested with bedbugs, a toilet seat that was actually attached and internet in the room. Do yourself a favor and pay more for a nice stay, it is worth it for your hygiene and peace of mind!

Reviews.Title: “Bad, bed bugs infest!”
Reviews.Author: missV101
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed here for a 4 day visit to London. Got bitten by bed bugs for over 200 times and when home had to to be treated by a hospital specialist. Put in a complaint and they said it could not happen in their hotel, first and last time at Rose Court.

Reviews.Title: “That's a fridge, not a minibar! Quite bad, if I'm honest...”
Reviews.Author: myribitbroke
Reviews.Content: Regards the decor: there was a full size refrigerator, ostensibly from the eighties, not sure if in working order, quite beaten up... need I say more? Aside from the pleasant exterior and location this hotel was quite shabby generally, a bit on the run-down side to be classed as 'shabby chic'. Regards the service: staff were fairly pleasant. My girlfriend and I didn't stick around for the breakfast though, which like another review has noted, was in the basement - the entrance to which did not look appealing. In all fairness I did arrange this stay cheaply on lastminute.com, and it wasn't absolutely filthy the stay wasn't 'harrowing'. That said, it wasn't rough-around-the-edges in a charming way, more in a slightly unnerving way - I would try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Payment Upfront?”
Reviews.Author: rmc_pro
Reviews.Content: A shocking experience sums it all perfectly. The shocks started as soon as we enteredthe hotel. The decor was very tacky and cheap. It looked as though they shopped at Pound Stretcher. The scruffily dressed receptionist demanded to be paid before they even checked us in. This is the company policy. We got our keys and the room was a pokey and not veryu clean. The only clean things in there were the towels. The bathroom had hair in the bathub and the toilets had stains in it.The carpet was torn and the floorboards were very creaky indicating poor maintenance It took almsot half an hour for the water to heat up for the shower making us late for the dinner date. The following morning, we did not even have hot water so no showers. We missed out on breakfast as we did not trust their standards based on our experiences in the room. I would not recommend this Hotel to any one

Reviews.Title: “As well as can be expected”
Reviews.Author: Sterres12
Reviews.Content: Let's be honest about it: London is a freightfully expensive city. This goes for hotels in particular. So, either demand your usual level of comfort and pay an awful lot of money for a few nights or be prepared for something that's not up to what you would expect in other cities and spend the rest of your money on something else. We paid a little over a 100 pounds for a familyroom on the 5th floor. For that, we got just what I expected: a small room, with facilities that were not so much dirty as very old, a broken lamp and tv set, an uncaring receptionist; an unexiting breakfast and some flirty waiters (a bargain after all :)). But hey, we had a wonderful time in London. And because we were quite tired at the end of the day we didn't notice the room a lot and certainly didn't spend a lot of energy in being disappointed or angry, One note to that: the lack of an escape route in case of an emergency would be slightly worrying to anyone. The location of the hotel, very near Paddington Station, is near perfect, which goes for the other 5 million hotels in the same area too, however. If anyone has experiences with hotels in London that offer better opportunities for the same amount of money, I would love to hear them :)

Reviews.Title: “Try to find something better”
Reviews.Author: sweetie415
Reviews.Content: Being from the United States and never having been to Europe, I was at the mercy of the system. This place was NOT what I would call "acceptable" - I would not stay there again. In the end we didn't get a disease or robbed or anything, but we felt dirty the whole time. There were black hairs on the sheets/pillows, mold in the bathroom, broken window and you had to leave your key with the front desk attendant anytime you left. The first time we came back there was a different attendant (who had not actually SEEN us) and he gave us the key without even asking for any kind of identification. It was expensive, but not THAT bad compared to other ones. All the reviews had bad things to say about it, but I booked through a travel agent (who had never been to London nor had booked anyone in this particular hotel) - my advice is keep looking!

Reviews.Title: “we had a great time at the rose court”
Reviews.Author: dantheman156
Reviews.Content: after my partner booked us 3 days at the rose court for my birthday as a surprise, i decided to check on other peoples reviews, and quite frankly was worried with what i saw. there werent many good reviews to put it bluntly, however we decided for 2 nights only we would give it a go....and i must say, we were really pleased yes our room was small, but certainly big enough for two. bathroom was tiny...but it made us laugh. it was clean, staff were very friendly...it is an aging hotel but the best thing was the location. 5 mins from 2 tube stations breakfast times were very busy unless you went at 7am when it was just us after reading several bad reviews about this hotel, after our visit, i thought i should give it a little bit of praise thanks to all at the rose court, you made my birthday, ill definitely return

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for those who plan to visit London and stay out all day”
Reviews.Author: FredLicinio
Reviews.Content: Nice location near underground (Padington and Lancaster Gate). The room and bathroom were clean, decoration and furniture were awful but the bed was ok, with clean sheets. The shower in bathroom should be replaced because it was difficult to balance cold and hot water. The staff was ok but there is a "lot of room" for improvement. Breakfast was minimally acceptable. Resuming, it's a good hotel for those who plan to visit London and stay out all day, paying the least possible for lodging and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs and bloodstains”
Reviews.Author: vanillaboat
Reviews.Content: This place needs to be shut down. Don't be fooled by the nice photos on the internet- inside, this hotel is rotting. There were bloodstains on my bedspread, cracks and dirt marks on the walls, the shower was broken, the toilet door was broken and the carpet was FILTHY and RIDDLED WITH BUGS, as was the bed- these drove me out. I had to battle and battle with the rude, unhelpful and very foreign staff who chose not to understand me whenever they pleased to get a refund for my remaining nights. This meant i couldn't finish the internship placement i had for two weeks this summer. The 'continental' breakfast was a choice between chewy cornflakes and branflakes and cardboard toast in their dingy, window-less pit in the basement. Staying on the fourth floor, there were three different staircases and it was a huge fire hazard. PLEASE PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOLE.

Reviews.Title: “What I named the HOSTEL !!!! LIVING HELL !”
Reviews.Author: Fletch2007
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say .....except a living hell ! Myself and 2 friends stayed in a triple room THANKFULLY for one night only - and this was only because after checking other hotels in London there was no vacancies so we had to stick with it or sleep on the streets - and to be honest sleeping on the streets sounded a lot more inviting !!! On arriving the reception/lounge area was dark and dingie looking the leather sofa had a huge tear in it and the tv was a tiny portable and the picture was barely watchable ! All I could think was HOSTEL ! We were told our room was on the 1st floor - thankfully as there was no way we were getting in the lift !!!!! It was all rusty looking and you had to close the door behind you - no way, we took the stairs ! We entered our room and was mortified to see stained walls (with what, we don't know) a built in chest of drawers 2 didn't open and the 3rd which did open had a rodent repellent box in it - as you can imagine we quickly shut this as we didn't want to see if there was anything in there - the curtains didnt fit the windows and were absolutely stinkng dirty ...the floor boards creaked wherever you stood, the bathroom was tiny, the toilet seat slanted to one side and all the tiles on the wall need ripping off they were absolutely minging dirty ! The balcony doors didn't shut properly and the window frames were slowly falling apart !!! As for the staff I can't really comment they told us where our room was and we had to request a iron which he basically passed to us but didn't speak (oh the iron was all taped up at the bottom where it was obviously dropped on the floor) anyway we made a quick get-away in the morning there was no way we were attempting breakfast !!!! So in all said and done we will DEFINITELY NOT EVER be staying in this hotel ever again and in my opinion the place should be shut down !!! We paid Â£120 for one night of living hell !! I would not recomment this hotel to my worst enemy .....DO NOT STAY HERE !!! Oh and don't let the pictures on the internet swing you as this hotel looks nothing like this - they must of been taken 10+ years ago !

Reviews.Title: “Dirty and bugs”
Reviews.Author: SnipHolland
Reviews.Content: I took my 14 year old son to London for a city trip of 3 days. He enjoyed the city very much, but the hotel was terrible! The room was on the 4th floor, a labyrinth of stairs (how on earth could we go down safely in case of a fire), a tiny lift...........and most of all, it was not clean. The shower was covered in chalk and other undefined substance, we did dare to touch it. O.k., the beds were brandnew, the sheet appeared clean, but there were bugs in the room, all sorts, yak! It was the carpet that was very dirty and house to all the bugs. I get itchy all over again, just writing about it! The staff was not very interested in the welness of their guests. We did take the breakfast in the hotel, the breakfastroom was in the basement, no window and didnot show too clean nor inviting. We went out and had a great (english) breakfast around the corner at Louis'sandwichshop, under pound's 10,= for the 2 of us. The only good thing of the hotel was the location, near the Circle Line (Paddington station at 200 mtrs) and the Central Line (Lancster Gate at 300 mtrs), and close to one of the routes of the Original Tour Bus. If it had been clean it would have been een great hotel at a great location, now I would never go there again......the bugs even came out of my bag at home, Yeeh!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenifersb
Reviews.Content: Positives: Nice location close to tube; friendly staff; decent breakfast included; internet access in lobby; nice big bathroom in room Negatives: Room furnishings were outdated and not very cozy; bed somewhat uncomfortable

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: Helene_1982
Reviews.Content: Going with the whole family (parents, uncles, aunts, cousins etc) I was not the person planning and booking our London trip. If I had, I would never have booked this hotel, and after learning the name I was dreading staying here due to horrible, horrible reviews on Tripadvisor (opinions I value highly). Nontheless, the hotel was booked and we were staying here. First-impression; Ok, not the most friendly of receptionists (to say the least) Room was ok, bathroom was ok, both clean. Was not blown away by the room, but the beds were firm, had clean sheets (if you get a dirty room, you complain and ask for it to be washed) and did the job perfectly well. The curtains kept the light out and the sound was also kept out. Quite small bathroom, but it had a shower, toilet and wash, all you need. If people expect luxury they have to expect to pay alot more. Seriously, you get what you pay for. The location is the best thing about the hotel, very close by central London, tube and buses. Breakfast was nice and simple, toast, jam, cereal, milk and juice. Perfectly doable. Its a shame this hotel has so many horrible reviews, we might have been lucky, but if your room is not clean, ask them to clean it. If you expect more then a room, a bed and a breakfast, find a pricier and "better" hotel. Oh, and the receptionist was alot friendlier the rest of our stay, even they are allowed to be tired :)

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: Irish-Eyes757
Reviews.Content: Travelled from Ireland to London for a over night stay at the Rose Court Hotel through the internet which looked quite nice from the website photos! Upon arrival we booked in at reception and was asked to pay for the accommodation straight away! We were shown to our room! To start off with the bedroom door was busted open, obvisiously by a previous unhappy guest, then to our utmost disgust the room hadn't seen a cleaner for a considerable period, six to twelve months I would predict!! We were shown to a second room, however to was no better if not worst! We returned to reception to receive our refund and leave to find alternative, however we were told that the manager wasn't available and wouldn't be! After quite a number of telephone calls to the manager when I returned home, I managed to speak to him! He was extremely rude and unhelpful stating that 'what else did I expect for a 2 star hotel'. After much deliberation he said he would do me a favour and refund me half my money, even though we weren't in the hotel for more than 15 minutes. Not my idea for sight seeing, paying to see filthy rooms!! Please take my advice, do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs - Stay Away”
Reviews.Author: ethangl
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a filthy "hotel" with bedbugs that will ruin your entire vacation, this is the place for you. Otherwise, STAY AWAYS FROM THIS DUMP!

Reviews.Title: “Smelly and dirty”
Reviews.Author: mmaldo1366
Reviews.Content: So sooryy we stayed here. It was a cheap and dirty place. Well NEVER stay at this type of hole in the wall again.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped but good value for London”
Reviews.Author: Longdrop
Reviews.Content: Convenient if seedy hotel. Rooms cramped, tiny lift and poor shower. Clean enough and staff are OK. Breakfast pretty basic.

Reviews.Title: “it was pretty ok”
Reviews.Author: happYclient92
Reviews.Content: the staff was really nice and the chamber was very clean, but there was a tiny shower. However, it was better that I expected. it was a nice sweet little hotel and I really enjoyed it there.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable hell”
Reviews.Author: XquziQ
Reviews.Content: My partner tried to treat me to a weekend in london in october and the break itself was fantastic, being my first time in the city, spoilt only due to our hotel....the "Rose Court" The only good thing i can say about this place is the location, being so easily accessable for the underground, trains and buses.....believe me...i can't stress enough that is the only good thing. The rooms are tiny, beds hard and generally in a poor state of decor. The bathrooms were rediculous,just about describeable as clean but being so tiny and badly designed that quite frankly the only comfortable way to use the toilet (which was squeezed in at the side of the shower) was when slightly tipsy so that you didn't care how you fell (the only way of being able to land on the toilet).The showers were so unpredictable it was reminiscent of a screwball comedy with taps being run and a poor unfortunate victim left screaming in the shower. The absolute joke was the security hangers in the wardrobes.....as if anyone would want to steal them to have a reminder of hell. My poor unfortunate partner had also in his wisdom in booking the "bed&breakfast" thought it quite a good offer with the traditional english or continental offerings.....We arrived at approx 9am (still in plenty time we thought) but neither of us were totally sure what the only food left on offer could be labelled from the 2 choices....all that was left was extremely greasy fried eggs and totally overcooked baked beans and that was with guests packed in like sardines and still arriving. Needless to say when we asked the staff about it they could not understand (or appeared to not understand) so we left still hungry The staff varied as anyone would expect in a London hotel but we left London still waiting for what should be accepted as good service. The was a 24hr service at the front door but it seemed the norm no matter the time of day to be met with generally rude sullen behaviour, or that is unless they were on the phone or eating their carry out food. More often than not the lift would be out of order, and when i say lift thats being generous....more like a tiny matchbox with a bit of string attached being hand cranked when someone could be bothered....very unsafe!!!!! I'm really quite fed up now writing about this $Â£&!-Â£%!& so i'm going to stop

Reviews.Title: “Average facilities but rude staff”
Reviews.Author: Crispycat1
Reviews.Content: When booking hotels in London do not expect to get much for the money. The facilities in this hotel is average (but old) when you take the price into account, but the staff could learn a lesson in service. While we were having our breakfast, we were told to "Please finish quickly. Other people are waiting". We had been sitting there for around 10 minuttes and still had food on our plates! Very rude in our oppinion!

Reviews.Title: “hands down the worst hotel i ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rosiebuttons
Reviews.Content: on arrival we were given a family room as they had no spare doubles. on the secon day we were very rudely told to pack up and vacate the room in the morning as they got a last minute booking for a family and they would put our bags in a double as it comes vacant around 12, we got back at 5 to find our bags abandoned in reception. not once they said please or sorry!! breakfast was a farce and we werent allowed to sit with our family who had two spare seats, but had to sit on another table of four?! no sense when we went and sat with our family the waiter had a huge fit and raised his voice. the curtains wont close, hanging down the place is filthy!!! they just take your money and you get noservice in return! they were rude and would not look me in the eye! dont bother going there!!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Abu Ghraib"”
Reviews.Author: MPL205
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some very unpleasant hotels in my life. I've even been in a few dumps since I stayed here. Still, the grandly named "Rose Court Hotel" has managed to remain my yardstick for awful. When I first arrived in the hotel, I was happy that I'd saved a few bucks on the rate of the nearby hotel where a friend was staying in first class comfort. In retrospect, I should have spent the money. My initial room was little more than a closet. Being 6'3" I couldn't even keep my ankles in the bed. The shower had no water pressure. The floors, walls, ceiling, furniture, bedding, even the power sockets were dirty. With the prospect of avoiding the filth glimering on the horizon, I stupidly upgraded to a room meant for two people. There, I could lay on the bed, though I had to do it diagonally. That was were the nicities ended. The TV cable, for example, had to go out the window to the antenna, so the window had to remain open a crack. The bathroom was moldy and gross. I'm a bachelor and it was worse than mine when I went months without cleaning it. The bedding had the odd blood stain on it, but the mattress looked like someone had been murdered on it. There was no room to walk around the room and indeed to open my bag I had to put it on the bed. The food was not good, the service was awful (the night guy looked annoyed I'd come in after nine at night) and it was a workout to get my bags in or out of the hotel. The elevator was like a coffin. I think it was only meant for people who need a wheelchair. I had to hunch to stand in it. Later in my trip I stayed in a cheaper place in Southwark that looked like it was taken from a Calvin Klein ad. Gorgeous. And my friend who was staying nearby was living it up with his free wifi while I was living in squalor. I hear they have bugs now, so in a way I'm glad I stayed when I did.

Reviews.Title: “If you expect to get what you pay for - everything is fine!”
Reviews.Author: Ellinor_C
Reviews.Content: My friend and I arrived at the Rose Court Hotel expecting the worst, because of all the "terrifying" reviews we had read. But we were pleasantly surpriced since the hotel actually was pretty good for a tourist class hotel. It was old and very simple, with a tiny elevator and a tiny bathroom - but hey, that's all you can expect from a hotel this cheap! After all, I have stayed at several tourist class hotels in London before, and I have to say this was the best of them. The staff were helpful, the rooms were clean, the beds were fine and actually comfortable, the breakfast was ok and the location was great! We had a room on the fifth floor and had to walk some stairs since the elevator stopped at the fourth. There were extra pillows in the wardrobe and you could make tea in the room. The worst thing was the lousy shower that didn't work so well, but - we kind of had expected that too... We didn't spend much time in the hotel during our three days, but we slept well every night and I would recommend this hotel to any friend on a budget trip to London.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: madsmj
Reviews.Content: Rose Court Hotel is a cheap hotel in every sense of the word. You don't pay much, you don't get much. But if you're in London for a short stay and wish to spend your money in the shops and restaurants, it's fine. Old and worn, but in a nice neighbourhood, close to Paddington Station. The staff is generally nice, but the people in the small and crowded breakfast room are stressed and irritable. We skipped breakfast the last two mornings.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Akka_100
Reviews.Content: The day we were to go to London I read some reviews of this hotel, and I was completely terrified. "Bedbugs, terrible beds, broken elivators". I can say that I was gladly surprised when we found that this was not the case for us. It was not a large room, but enough to for us (3 people) to sleep in. The sheets were clean and the beds were made everyday. Beds were a bit hard, but we could sleep. The bathroom was small but enough, a shower, a toilet and a sink. It was not shiny, but what to expect?!! The window did shut and we couldn't hear traffick. Although, bring earplugs if you are sensitive. The elivator was not broken, but a bit small. The staff was helpful and serviceminded, we got the extra pillows we wanted. The breakfast contained of eggs and beans. Toast with butter, jam and cheese. Milk with cornflakes and branflakes. Juice and water, tea and coffee. This hotel was more or less what we paid for, we were not dissapointed anyway. "Cheap and good location".

Reviews.Title: “A no-frills, good value.”
Reviews.Author: Traveladdictohmy
Reviews.Content: The Rose Court Hotel at 1-3 Talbot Square, London W2 1TR, England is a fine place to sleep. If you plan on spending any time in your room, you will get cabin fever quickly, as this is a very small room with one window. You get your bed made daily, as well as a clean towel. You do not receive washcloths. I would've liked a fan because it got stuffy. We used a shoebox to prop open the window to get air circulation. The shower has little pressure and the water temperature doesn't stay consistent, so beware. Also, don't make the mistake I did, of touching the water faucet, or you'll be scalded. The toilet is a little slow to flush. If you go in knowing these things, you'll be fine. The bed is very hard, but I slept well. The pillows are about 1" thick, so we folded 2 of them in half. Everything in London is old, so expect it. Talbot Square is within a block of Paddington Station. You can easily walk there for Tube access. There are several small shops and pubs within a block, also. There are a few small restaurants nearby. I thought the location was nice and quiet, not on a main street with buses, and people screaming. One of the employees is very nice and helpful. The breakfast is down in the basement and consists of toast, eggs, baked beans and cereal. They also have coffee and tea. It's free, so it can save you money on food. We tried the tiny lift twice and we didn't get stuck, so use it if you have a lot of luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: RangerL
Reviews.Content: I had read poor reviews about this hotel but figured it couldn't be as bad as everyone made it sound but it was. The bed was rock hard with no bounce, the pillows were flatter than pancakes, the shower stall was filthy and I could keep going. There was one friendly man who worked at the front counter who printed out tube and bus directions for us but the rest of the staff were not as helpful. The location was great - located between Paddington and Lancaster Gate tube stations. If you want to stay near here look anywhere along Sussex Gardens - it's full of similar row hotels which must be better than where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting room, nice staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: lablover2Oregon
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to London and Edinburgh for our 20th wedding anniversary. We were on a budget, and I found a great deal on this hotel. We wanted the quintessential European experience in lodging, and this looked good online. After arriving at Paddington station and taking the short hike to the hotel, (2 blocks away) we were given a room on the 4th floor. Interesting layout, and quite a trek to get to the room. My husband took the lift, a bit slow and small, but with the luggage it was the only way to go. We had 3 twins that were very comfortable, and a bathroom that had a horrible shower. Otherwise, the view was not great, we could close the window, but chose to leave it open, little TV reception, and noisy hallway. But we weren't there for the accomodations really, we just needed a place to sleep, we were too busy with the sights and exploring. For that purpose, this is a great hotel, location is good, don't bother with the free breakfast, the place to go is located on Praed Street and is called The Shakers. It's the best, nice people, really great food and wonderful atmosphere. After eating breakfast, grab a sandwich to go, and have fun seeing the sights! J & K Philips Oregon

Reviews.Title: “Cheap budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jadpe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for just one night in this hotel. The location of the hotel was perfect, just one block away from the tube (paddington) and the neighborhood was ok. A few deli's and restaurants, we've seen no supermarket. Our room was in the basement because we had a quadruple room. The room was very small and in spite of it was freezing outside we had an airco. And the airco was definitly necessary, it was so incredibly hot inside! I guess our room was next to the heating installation. The beds and the bathroom were clean, but the maid could have done a better job. We stayed her only one night so it was not a big issue for us. It is a good budget hotel for a few nights, but there are a lot more hotels in London who are cheaper and better.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: CB1Belfast
Reviews.Content: Extremely disappointed. Old, neglected, dull, dirty. Staff disinterested. Thankfully only 1 night, if it had been more would have went somewhere else. Only positive thing was location.

Reviews.Title: “The worst room I have ever booked in London”
Reviews.Author: marty50s
Reviews.Content: This was by far the worse lodging experience I ever had in London. I would have moved to another hotel immediately but I did not have the time. Live and learn. The room: broken windows that would not close, cracked window glass, dirty floor, unplugged lamps that would not work, tiny TV without remote control, mildew in the bathtub and walls, small basin, dirty shower curtains. The breakfast: shabby area, white bread toasts, sugared orange drink, watered coffee, awful-looking fried eggs, sugared cereal. The pluses? Very friendly reception staff, a quiet location two blocks away from Paddington Station. However, this does not compensate for the minuses. I will never stay at Rose Court again nor I can recommend it to anybody other than backpackers and desperate travelers who cannot find lodging elsewhere. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere. There are better hotels in London for the same price or even less. Also, do not confuse this hotel with the four-star Rose Court Hotel in Marble Arch, which appears to be nice (that was my mistake).

Reviews.Title: “Travellers Nightmare on Talbot Square!!!”
Reviews.Author: BedrockTours
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Hotel expecting small, basic , clean rooms only to find an absolutely disgusting, smelly pig sty. As a party of 8 we were able to inspect all 4 rooms...the worst one we chtristened "The Lower Basement Dungeon". This place is an absolute joke....I only wish we had of checked this website before booking. We ended up walking out and checking in to the Abbey Court across the road which is 1000 times better value. We have travelled the world several times and never have encountered such crap! I can't believe a 2 stars rating....even a convicted prisoner would refuse to stay in this poor excuse for a hotel. Do NOT contemplate staying here. It's disappointing to find his hotel in a wonderful City like London and Expedia should never promote such a crappy dump!!!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Parisnyc_8
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room and had a terrible experience. The complaint we made at reception was ignored. The room we were shown (G06) had no windows and no form of ventilation apart from an air pump in the room with a huge tube leading through the "window" into another room (i.e., not outside) and thus recycling the same air through the rooms. It was stifling and smelly. In addition, the room was right next to reception where staff and their friends were talking loudly from Saturday evening until 6:00am on Sunday morning. The beddings, moreover, also smelt and did not appear to have been washed. We did not sleep at all that night.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BristolC
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews on here after already having made my booking I feared the worst. But it was absolutely no problem with this hotel!! Yes, it's only two stars and you have to take that in consideration. Above average for me. A very nice old city house that has kept the old style. Bathroom (room 505) maybee from the fiftees but still working alright. Beds a bit hard but no problem. Friendly staff and ok breakfast. Elevator worked all stay (fifth floor). Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but... yuk!”
Reviews.Author: AngryLoner
Reviews.Content: Oh my word! First thing I did upon arrival (whilst carefully averting my eyes from the grim surroundings, peeling paint, stained bedding, filthy carpet etc etc) was attempt to boil the kettle for a nice cuppa. This took an absolute age, and when the kettle had boiled, there was hardly any water in it... the kettle was leaking badly, with electric points situated precariously beneath just to add to the sense of danger and fun! As I looked from the window, I admired the view; a thirty foot drop onto what appeared to be some sort of rusting old piece of agricultural machinery, surrounded by bags of rubbish and large discarded boxes, and no visible skyline, merely the backs of other hotels, creating a sense of overwhelming claustrophobia and doom. As I peeled the paint from the window sill, I contemplated what might happen in the event of a fire, should I have to use this window as a means of escape, and hurriedly pushed the thought to the back of my head. Breakfast the next morning was very surreal. I am not sure how they managed to fry the eggs and make them all stick together in a large, (roughly) square block of congealed yolk, fat and egg-white, but somehow it worked, and would have done Tracey Emin proud as a form of modern artwork. Also on the menu was some tepid baked beans. The bacon, sausages and hash-browns must have done a runner somewhere, probably in terror at the sight of the horrifying 'egg-square monster thang'. Toast was eventually forthcoming, but the only butter on offer tasted a bit like having an affair with your aging granny; very unpleasant, and leaving a bad taste in your mouth. On the plus side, the orange juice was quite nice. In all fairness, I've stayed in a lot worse places, and I don't really mind 'roughing it', but am aware that many expect a certain basic standard and rightly so, and I don't think this place meets those standards at all. If you like your stay to be dark, dirty and dreary, then this is definitely the place for you! If not, then avoid like the plague. The location is great though, with Paddington Station and underground just a short walk away, and bars, restaurants and takeaways aplenty.

Reviews.Title: “A complete joke”
Reviews.Author: lynzngaz
Reviews.Content: As we emerged from Paddington station, we had to pass by the Hilton hotel in order to get to Rose court 'hotel'. We were looking forward to a nice cosy room with tea and coffee and the other bits and bobs you normally expect in a cheap hotel, after a long jouney and before a night on the town. as we turned into Talbot Square, we saw the dimley lit hotel and i commented to my husband that i had 'high hopes'. However, the frizzy haired receptionist could barely speak english, and interrupted us to answer a phonecall of which appeared to be a friend from another country. We waited patiently, and when she turned back to us, she handed us the key and mumbled directions to the room. After several 'guesses' of where the room may be, we had to return to ask her again. She finally got off her seat and waved a hand towards the door down the end of the corridoor. Upon entry, we were now feeling slightly let down. We opened what appeared to be a front door to the room, which then led us inside to our bedroom. I have to be honest it was quite dissapointing to see that there were cracks all along the walls, and there were 3 other beds in there! Our double bed was shoved up against an old fireplace, on an angle, an an old pink sofa covered the plug socket which hung completely off the wall. There was a tiny packet of coffee, but no herbal tea of milk. My hasband had to go to reception to ask for milk, were he was handed a 4 pint used carton of old milk which had a bit left over in the bottom. There was also no hairdryer and i had to go and request one from reception. There were spelling mistakes on the fire instuctions on the back of the door, but no welcome pack or introduction to the hotel, statig breakfast times and options. I also had to go and ask about this. I was extremely suprised when i walked into the teeny weeny toilet and stood on the cold, rocky, broken tiles. The window wouldn't close so it was freezing, and there was limescale and toothpaste staines on the sink and bin. Horrible!! The shower was worse. I had to squeeze sideways past it to open the door fully, and when i climbed in, i found plaster in there hangig from the walls. I had to wash away all the bits before showering. The shower head didn't work properly and water squirted from two different points on the shower which casued a leak on the floor.I could go on about all the faults of this room but breakfat was the worst In the morning we were up by half 8 and managed to find a table in the 'breakfast room' of which the tables were covered by plastic stuff and left over jam. Again, a waiter who couldnt speak a word of english, threw a pile of tatty toast onto the table and walked off. I looked around and found some beans, a pile of rubbery 'eggs' and three piles of cereal, two of which were of the same kind. I waited patiently for the rest of the breakfast to arrive, the bacon and sausages, only to find that that was it! When asked for some marmalade, the grumpy waiter rolled his eyes and gave a tut before walking off. He then went and wiped a table and didnt bother with our marmalade. We asked him again several minuites later, and he pointed to a pile of toast. After repeating that we wantd marmalade, he finally understood and went to fetch some, dumping in on a competely different table for us to go and get it ourselves. We could only laugh about this i suppose as we could see the funny side of this awful 'hotel' and went to get breakfast elsewere. We left our bags in reception for the day which were not closely monitored. I would never return to this terrible hotel, especially for 80 quid a night! it was convenient and that was it! in the future, i will not stand mouldy, smelly, dirty accomodation. ill go somewhere else next time just awful

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: babyboomerBrisbane
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at how comfortable this B&B was. The reception was very helpful, when we requested a twin room, rather than a double which we had booked (we'd found, by then that double beds were too small for us). She gave us, at no extra cost, a triple bed room, so there was lots of room to spread out. True, the bathroom was small, but adequate. Breakfast was a buffet - juice, tea/coffee, cereals, eggs and baked beans, toast with butter, cheeses and jams - more than what we'd expected for a "continental breakfast". Location was really good, we could walk through Kensington Park to Buckingham Palace, the tube was just a stone's throw away. On our last day, we left our luggage at the reception, spent the morning sightseeing, then bought lunch at a nearby supermarket, and returned to the hotel to eat in comfort in the guest lounge. The receptionist had booked a taxi to take us to the airport, and when this arrived, the manager even gave us a hand with the luggage!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Little Dirty Rathole!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Meraai8
Reviews.Content: This is the worse hotel(not sure you can call it a hotel!!) that I have ever stayed it. The bathroom is so filthy and small and the door cannot close. The shower water runs on the floor and into the bedroom. If you sit on the bed you are less than a meter away from the toilet. There was also no window on this third floor room. The plugs nor the hairdryer worked. Breakfast was jam and toast and coffee. DO NOT STAY IN THIS PLACE! READ ALL THE OTHER COMMENTS FROM PREVIOUS GUESTS!

Reviews.Title: “Yuk!”
Reviews.Author: Titania123
Reviews.Content: Wow, we are not very picky, but we draw the line when there is stained blood and urine on the inside of the bedspread. The room was small, which we can deal with no problem, but dirt is another thing. There is mold on the ceiling of the bathroom, and there was a sticky thing on the dirty carpet that my foot would get stuck on every time I got out of the bed.....Good Luck if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Low level”
Reviews.Author: Bunny_Titan
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here. Location is excellent, near Paddington Station, but unfortunately that is the one and only good point. Double room was very small with dirty carpet and radiator filled with dust. The bathroom looked like that it needed immediate measures: toilet seat not fixed on the floor, loose tiles, rusty shower cabinetÂ´s bottom sink, mold on the corner seam... The staff is friedly and breakfast is, well, OK. Next time we are definetely looking another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Room the size of a postage stamp”
Reviews.Author: Alvar_Aalto
Reviews.Content: I paid GBP30 per night for a single room (apparently, they have only one such room) that came with a "half ensuite". There was a standing shower and a sink, but no toilet. The toilet was located on the stairs two and a half floors down. Drying myself after taking a bath evolved into a delicate art form.
