There was no space in the bathroom to bend down to dry my legs, so I had to keep the bathroom door ajar, to allow my elbow to stick out and then bend down to dry myself, while at the same time planting my foot on the edge of where the bath's slate tile met the room's carpeting, to prevent the bathwater from running out into the room (the bath is built on the same level as the room floor, with no step down, so the water will flow into the room if not stopped). The room was located on the sixth floor (in the roof); the elevator only went to the fifth. I had a great view, being rather high up. There was just NO space for anything - opening my suitcase took up all the available floor space. None of the doors could open fully - the bedroom door opened halfway and hits the foot of the bed; the bathroom door opened halfway and touched the side of the bed. The location was perfect with Paddington Station and Tube, Lancaster Gate Tube, Hyde Park (enter via Italian Gardens) very accessible; the receptionist was friendly and a good source of information; the TV in good working order; checking in and out were hassle-free. However, the promised telephone and hair dryer were both elusive; the breakfast unpalatable; the bedspread blood-stained; the wire bed-springs on the verge of bursting out of the mattress and shredding my back each night; the staircases and corridors a veritable labyrinth. I ended up laughing it all off - stay here if you're on a tight budget, are going to spend most of the day out on the town, and can see the humour when the joke's on you.

Reviews.Title: “Just awful--zero stars”
Reviews.Author: Gemmaney
Reviews.Content: Just awful. Hostel-like accomondations without the Hostel price. Room G01 is abismal. Sadly, we paid US $200 for stained yucky mattresses, dirty bedspreads and blankets, pillows as thick as a sheet of paper and black mold all over the filthy bathroom. The breakfast is equally depressing served by grumpy staff. I'd be grumpy if I had to spend half a day in the dank basement passing out toast with my bare hands too. Keep looking for someplace better--do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby and grubby ... yuk!”
Reviews.Author: Yorkie6017
Reviews.Content: It looks pleasant from the front and the reception area is OK. Once you get into the hotel proper be prepared for, at best, shabby and, at worst, dilapidated public areas. The horrors really begin when you enter your room. Dirty carpets, filthy (bloodstained) bedspreads, curtains that don't meet in the middle, horrible cramped bathrooms, dirty walls, peeling wallpaper, you name it. It's the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The only positives are the bed sheets and towels were clean. I took many photographs of the interior and have complained to Discount Hotels who made the booking. This establishment desperately needs refurbishment before it dares to call itself an hotel and takes in paying customers. A disgrace to UK tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and found it terrible! Breakfast can't even be calles breakfast, room is very small, filthy and we even had products of former hotelquests in a gap between the showercabin and the sink. We complained about this and got excuses, so many you couldn't count, but nothing happened. Tv didn;t work properly...no fixed. Overall we had a very bad experience with this hotel and i wouldn't recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever went”
Reviews.Author: John087
Reviews.Content: It was a nightmare. The staff was rude and the room was dirty. Also the food was very bad.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID ROSE COURT TALBOT SQUARE LONDON UK”
Reviews.Author: DELECHELLE
Reviews.Content: As a product manager in the tourism industry it is my duty to inform that the above hotel which you present in you site has rooms with terrible conditions of health and safety. Please urgently send any of your product team to check some parts of hotel and services. Room 302 for exemple has enormous stains oN mattresses and on carpet on floor ; it seems as if never cleaned and bathroom also uncleaned with corrosion on taps , rust and dust. I would strongly advise you to inspect property and decide whether to sell or stop sales. Best regards FranÃ§ois Filloux

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: BookloverOxon
Reviews.Content: Ideal for weekend stopover, size of bathroom may get to you after that. Don't think you can find anything else reasonable and cheaper for this location. Not for you if you expect bland international hotel style but if you don't mind ceiling fans instead of aircon and an eccentric lift, you'll find good service and good breakfasts. Hope they don't refurbish the character out of it! Karen and Rachel, 10th March 07.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: redscarfox
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got just what we expected for our money. Ok its not luxurious but for London its cheap. The room/bathroom was small and basic but the bed linen was clean and looked new. The breakfast was better than expected and the staff were very friendly and helpful

HotelInfo.Name: Rose Court Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1 - 3 Talbot Square | Paddington, London W2 1TR, England
